fact: Solar flares can release energy equal to millions of nuclear bombs.
Auroras are caused by charged particles colliding with Earth's atmosphere.
Strong solar storms can knock out power grids on Earth.
The Sun's magnetic field flips every 11 years during solar maximum.
Solar wind travels at speeds up to 800 km/s (500 miles per second).
The largest solar storm in recorded history was the Carrington Event in 1859.
Auroras can be seen from space and even from other planets like Jupiter.
Solar flares are classified from A (weakest) to X (strongest) class.
The International Space Station orbits in the Van Allen radiation belts.
Solar storms can cause beautiful auroras visible as far south as Florida.
NASA's Parker Solar Probe is the fastest human-made object, reaching 700,000 km/h.
The Sun's corona is hotter than its surface - over 1 million degrees Celsius.
Solar storms can disrupt GPS navigation systems used by airplanes and ships.
Auroras make sounds! People have reported hearing crackling and hissing sounds.
The Sun loses 4 million tons of mass every second through solar wind.
Solar flares can cause radio blackouts that last for hours.
Auroras on Jupiter are 100 times more powerful than Earth's auroras.
The Sun's magnetic field creates beautiful patterns called coronal loops.
Solar storms can cause compass needles to point in wrong directions.
The Northern Lights can be seen from space as a glowing ring around Earth.
